<copyright>Copyright Bellmedia</copyright>           <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Slave Lake residents say fire cleanup will test Fort McMurray]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/slave-lake-residents-say-fire-cleanup-will-test-fort-mcmurray-1.2900469</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Cleaning up Fort McMurray's wildfire will test the city's ability to handle everything from asbestos to rotting food and leave a lasting legacy of higher costs and dangerous residue, say residents of Slave Lake which saw one-third of the town burn in a fire five years ago.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Bob Weber]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2900469</guid>
    <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:02:25 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:02:25 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.1282038.1463115554!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[All that remains of a house in Slave Lake, Alberta, on Monday, May 16, 2011 is a set of steps. (Ian Jackson / THE CANADIAN PRESS)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[RCMP pleads not guilty on Labour Code charges in Moncton rampage deaths]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/rcmp-pleads-not-guilty-on-labour-code-charges-in-moncton-rampage-deaths-1.2899025</link>
    <description><![CDATA[The RCMP has pleaded not guilty to four charges of Labour Code violations stemming from the force's response to a 2014 shooting rampage in Moncton, N.B., that left three Mounties dead and two others wounded.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Kevin Bissett]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899025</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 08:52:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:28:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2461646.1463057497!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Police keep watch on a house as they search for a heavily armed gunman following the shooting of three Mounties in Moncton, N.B., on June 5, 2014. (Marc Grandmaison / THE CANADIAN PRESS)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Fort McMurray fire: Smoke plumes drift toward Edmonton]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/fort-mcmurray-fire-smoke-plumes-drift-toward-edmonton-1.2899977</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Air quality in Edmonton is at heightened risk as plumes of smoke blow from the massive Fort McMurray wildfire and spread across northern Alberta.]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[CTVNews.ca Staff]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899977</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:32:11 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:32:11 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2899998.1463092080!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Smoke billows from wildfires as RCMP man a checkpoint on the highway to Fort McMurray, Alberta wildfires that are still burning out of control Saturday, May 7, 2016. (THE CANADIAN PRESS / Ryan Remiorz)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Quebec minister refuses to sign off on new, controversial history course]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/quebec-minister-refuses-to-sign-off-on-new-controversial-history-course-1.2899440</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Quebec's education minister is refusing to sign off on a contentious new high school history program that has been harshly criticized by the province's minority communities.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Giuseppe Valiante]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899440</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:59:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:18:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2899447.1463072268!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Quebec Education and Family Minister Sebastien Proulx at the legislature in Quebec City on April 20, 2016. (Jacques Boissinot / THE CANADIAN PRESS)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA['He meant the world to me': Canadian man drowns in Mexico ]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/he-meant-the-world-to-me-canadian-man-drowns-in-mexico-1.2900210</link>
    <description><![CDATA[A Canadian woman is grieving alone in Mexico after her husband drowned while swimming on Wednesday. ]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[CTVNews.ca Staff]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2900210</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:13:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:13:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2900225.1463098234!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[The couple was married in 2014, and Zoltani had two children from a previous marriage. (Source: Facebook)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[N.L. volunteer ousted from Christmas box charity for pro-gay, pro-choice views]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/n-l-volunteer-ousted-from-christmas-box-charity-for-pro-gay-pro-choice-views-1.2899817</link>
    <description><![CDATA[A Newfoundland woman ousted as a volunteer leader for a Christian children's charity because she supports gay marriage and abortion says she has been overwhelmed with support for her stance.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Sue Bailey]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899817</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:15:02 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:15:02 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2899858.1463087478!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[In this Tuesday, Nov. 13, 2012 file photo, Operation Christmas Child boxes are seen at a church in Richland, Wash. (AP Photo / The Tri-City Herald, Richard Dickin)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Fort McMurray fire chief taking a break as efforts shift to rebuilding]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/fort-mcmurray-fire-chief-taking-a-break-as-efforts-shift-to-rebuilding-1.2899665</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Fort McMurray Fire Chief Darby Allen announced Thursday that he’s no longer director of emergency management and will take a brief break from firefighting duties to reconnect with his family. ]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Karolyn Coorsh and Graham Slaughter]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[CTVNews.ca ]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899665</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:03:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:33:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2899912.1463089201!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Fort McMurray Fire Chief Darby Allen speaks with reporters on Thursday, May 12, 2016. Allen says he's passing on his duties as director of emergency management and will take a brief break from firefighting to reconnect with his family. ]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Nuclear safety commission inspecting Fort McMurray area as a precaution]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/nuclear-safety-commission-inspecting-fort-mcmurray-area-as-a-precaution-1.2899729</link>
    <description><![CDATA[The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission is sending two specialists to Fort McMurray to help emergency personnel check out radiological devices that may have been affected by the wildfire. There are about 20 locations in the Fort McMurray area that have radiological devices.]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899729</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:39:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:39:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2899736.1463081883!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[The burned-out neighbourhood of Beacon Hill is seen in Fort McMurray, Alta., on Monday, May 9, 2016. (THE CANADIAN PRESS/Jonathan Hayward)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Accused Winnipeg mail bomber won't be released before trial]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/accused-winnipeg-mail-bomber-won-t-be-released-before-trial-1.2899705</link>
    <description><![CDATA[A Winnipeg man accused of sending letter bombs in the mail, including one that cost a lawyer her hand, has been denied his last chance at bail.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chinta Puxley]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899705</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:25:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:14:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2460891.1436439988!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Police have charged Guido Amsel with sending explosive devices to law firms and other businesses in Winnipeg. (Winnipeg Police Service)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Canadians aren't racist but aboriginal issues 'invisible' to many: Paul Martin]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/canadians-aren-t-racist-but-aboriginal-issues-invisible-to-many-paul-martin-1.2899634</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Racism isn't the culprit, but that doesn't change the fact that the challenges faced by Canada's Aboriginal Peoples have long remained out of sight and mind to many, says former Liberal prime minister Paul Martin.]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899634</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:50:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:51:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.1102754.1463078931!/httpImage/image.jpeg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpeg"><![CDATA[In this file photo, former prime minister Paul Martin delivers his address to the convocation after being conferred the degree Doctor of Laws from the University of Western Ontario in London, Ontario, Friday, June 18, 2010. (Dave Chidley / THE CANADIAN PRESS)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
        </channel>
